data.text:
About this Item

1909, First Edition and First Printing, Medallion Edition. Current Literature Publishing Co., N.Y. Bookplate of my Great Grandfather who was a Printer in Michigan, after having emigrated from England in 1897, where he was also a Printer. 396 pps, all in very good condition, albeit yellowed due to age. No Dustjacket. Wine Cloth boards with gilt lettering, slight rubbing of spine and a bit of a watermark on front board. Beautiful black and white photo of R.L. Stevenson frontispiece, tissue protected.Collectible. A collection of Stevenson's writing's, including The Merry Men, Will O' the Mill, Markheim, Thrawn Janet, Olalla, The Treasure of Franchard, and The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde. Wine Cloth HC Gilt Lettering. Condition: Fine ++. No Jacket. Medallion Edition- First Edition. x-lib; pp. 396; full b/w photo of author frontispiece tissue protected; collectible; viii; minor cover board shelf wear. Seller Inventory # 383

Contact seller

Report this item

I am a retired Sr Director from a Fortune 500 Company. I grew up the daughter of a High School English Teacher and a Professor of Olde English. I remember both of my parents reading to me from the wonderful collection of Charles Dickens Limited Editions, or the Jane Austen, or Faulkner- I could go on and on- however, both of my parents have passed on, and we have inherited all of these wonderful books. It is difficult for me to hold on to these all, so I wanted to sell them for the next generation of parents and children!--Live Life, Love Literature For a Price!

Visit Seller's Storefront

Seller's business information

Taylor & Baumann Books, LLC

CT, U.S.A.

Terms of Sale:

I love all of the books that i am/will be offering and am very connected to them based on wonderful childhood readings and parental readings every night after bath and before bed!

i commit to tell you honestly the details of every book from date and place of publishing, whether it is a first or limited edition and the condition of the book.

Shipping Terms:

every book ordered will be shipped in bubble wrap and carton. insurance will be included and within the United States i will pay for the shippin, unless over 35 lbs.
